title: Learning Discriminative Representations and Decision Boundaries for Open Intent Detection. (arXiv:2203.05823v3 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: Open intent detection is a significant problem in natural language understanding, which aims to identify the unseen open intent while ensuring known intent identification performance. However, current methods face two major challenges. Firstly, they struggle to learn friendly representations to detect the open intent with prior knowledge of only known intents. Secondly, there is a lack of an effective approach to obtaining specific and compact decision boundaries for known intents. To address these issues, this paper presents an original framework called DA-ADB, which successively learns distance-aware intent representations and adaptive decision boundaries for open intent detection. Specifically, we first leverage distance information to enhance the distinguishing capability of the intent representations. Then, we design a novel loss function to obtain appropriate decision boundaries by balancing both empirical and open space risks. Extensive experiments demonstrate the effectiveness

translated_title: 学习区分性表示和边界以进行开放式意图检测
translated_abstract: 开放式意图检测是自然语言理解中的一个重大问题，旨在识别未知的开放式意图，同时确保已知意图的识别性能。然而，当前的方法面临两个主要挑战。首先，它们无法学习友好的表示以在只有已知意图的先验知识下检测开放式意图。其次，缺乏获得已知意图的特定而紧凑的决策边界的有效方法。为了解决这些问题，本论文提出了一个名为DA-ADB的原始框架，该框架成功地学习了用于开放式意图检测的距离感知意图表示和自适应决策边界。具体而言，我们首先利用距离信息增强了意图表示的区分能力。然后，我们设计了一种新的损失函数，通过平衡经验和开放空间风险来获得适当的决策边界。广泛的实验证明了我们的框架在三个公共数据集上的有效性，它显著优于现有的最先进方法。
tldr: 本论文提出了一个名为DA-ADB的框架，通过学习距离感知意图表示和自适应决策边界来解决开放式意图检测中的两大挑战。在三个公共数据集上的实验证明了该框架的有效性和优越性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a framework called DA-ADB to address the two major challenges in open intent detection by learning distance-aware intent representations and adaptive decision boundaries. The effectiveness and superiority of the framework are demonstrated through extensive experiments on three public datasets.
